name: Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR)
description: Autonomous CCAs and Valkyrie units conduct pre-strike reconnaissance and transmit real-time data through Link 16 to CJADC2. Target tracking and dynamic retasking ensure the strike force has continuous intel updates.

name: Precision Strike Missions
description: CCAs and high-speed Quarterhorse aircraft coordinate to strike high-value targets with real-time networked control via CJADC2 and Link 16. Refuelers maintain endurance in high-threat environments.

name: Close Air Support (CAS)
description: Ground forces send targeting updates into CJADC2. CCAs conduct ISR overwatch while manned fighters execute precision attacks. Refuelers sustain operations for long-duration support.

name: Offensive Counter Air and Air Superiority
description: Fighters and CCAs maintain combat air patrol. Quarterhorse intercepts threats using CJADC2 data, while EW-equipped CCAs jam enemy systems and refuelers ensure operational longevity.

name: Electronic Warfare and Cyber Dominance
description: EW-equipped CCAs jam radar and communications. Link 16 and CJADC2 allow real-time tactical updates and frequency adaptation to maintain air dominance.

name: Autonomous Aerial Refueling and Sustainment
description: X-47 Pegasus and MQ-25 Stingray extend mission duration. NGAS provides modern refueling integration for unmanned and stealth platforms.

name: Decoy and Attritable Missions
description: XQ-58A Valkyries draw fire from enemy defenses, simulate high-value targets, and feed deception data back to CJADC2 for future targeting refinement.
